A news clip was published on Facebook on: 2020, showing Pakistani lawmakers chanting in favor of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
The clip was shared on India TV: s Twitter account on October 28, 2020, with a caption mentioning the chanting of "Modi Modi" slogans in Pakistan's parliament.
Multiple politicians from Modi: s Bharatiya Janata Party amplified the claim on social media, along with Indian media outlets and Facebook users sharing footage of the parliamentary debate.
However: a close analysis of the parliamentary proceedings revealed that the lawmakers were actually chanting "voting, voting" in Urdu, not "Modi, Modi." The chanting was in response to a resolution calling for a boycott of French goods, and later negative comments about Modi were made by Pakistani Foreign Minister Shah Mehmood Qureshi.
